ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:0.5_0: 64. The training rule on lying down
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people who were lying down. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone lying down who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.4_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone lying down who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone who is lying down and who is not sick, even if they are just lying on the ground, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.9_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
